label: Conjecture 2.1
text: For all integers $r \geq 2$, all $S \subseteq[r]$, and all $r$-colorings of a complete graph $K$, there exists a monochromatic $(r-1)$-cover consisting entirely of subgraphs having a color in $S$ or consisting entirely of subgraphs having a color in $[r] \backslash S$.

parameters.(r-1)-cover: Couverture monochromatique de taille au plus $(r-1)$ par des sous-graphes connexes couvrant $V(K)$

label: Conjecture 2.2
text: For all integers $r \geq 2$ and all $K \in \mathcal{K}_{r}, \operatorname{tc}_{r-1}(K) \leq r-1$. In particular, this implies that for every $r$-coloring of a complete graph $K$ and every color $i \in[r]$, either there is a monochromatic $(r-1)$-cover consisting entirely of subgraphs of color $i$, or entirely of subgraphs which don't have color $i$.

parameters.\\mathcal{K}_{r}: Famille de tous les graphes complets $r$-partis
parameters.\\operatorname{tc}_{r-1}(K): Plus petit $t$ tel que toute $r$-coloration des arêtes de $K$ admette une $t$-couverture monochromatique
parameters.(r-1)-cover: Couverture monochromatique de taille au plus $(r-1)$

label: Conjecture 2.3
text: For all integers $r \geq 3$ and all $K \in \mathcal{K}_{r-1}, \operatorname{tc}_{r-1}(K) \leq r-1$. In particular, this implies that for every $r$-coloring of a complete graph $K$ and every color $i \in[r]$, either there is a monochromatic $(r-2)$-cover consisting entirely of subgraphs of color $i$, or a monochromatic $(r-1)$-cover consisting entirely of subgraphs which don't have color $i$.

parameters.\\mathcal{K}_{k}: Famille de tous les graphes complets $k$-partis
parameters.(r-2)-cover: Couverture monochromatique de taille au plus $(r-2)$
parameters.(r-1)-cover: Couverture monochromatique de taille au plus $(r-1)$
parameters.\\operatorname{tc}_{r-1}(K): Paramètre de couverture par composantes connexes monochromatiques

label: Conjecture 2.4
text: For all integers $r \geq 2$, in every $r$-coloring of a complete graph $K$ there exists a monochromatic $(r-1)$-cover such that the monochromatic subgraphs have at most $\lceil r / 2\rceil$ different colors.

parameters.(r-1)-cover: Couverture monochromatique de taille au plus $(r-1)$
parameters.\\lceil r/2 \\rceil: Plafond de $r/2$ (nombre maximum de couleurs distinctes parmi les composantes)

label: Conjecture 2.8
text: For all $\alpha \geq 1$, there exists $d=d(\alpha)$ such that for all $r \geq 2$, if $G$ is a graph with $\alpha(G)=\alpha$, then in every $r$-coloring of $G$, there exists a monochromatic $(r-1) \alpha$-cover consisting of subgraphs of diameter at most $d$.

parameters.(r-1)\\alpha-cover: Couverture monochromatique de taille au plus $(r-1)\alpha$
parameters.\\operatorname{diam}(H): Diamètre d'un sous-graphe $H$ (distance maximale entre deux sommets)

label: Conjecture 2.14
text: There exists $d$ such that for all $r \geq 2$, if $K \in \mathcal{K}_{2}$, then in every $r$-coloring of $K$, there exists a monochromatic $(2 r-2)$-cover consisting of subgraphs of diameter at most d.

parameters.(2r-2)-cover: Couverture monochromatique de taille au plus $(2r-2)$

label: Conjecture 2.19
text: For all $r \geq 3$, in every $r$-coloring of $K_{n}^{r}$, there exists a monochromatic tightly connected subgraph which covers $V(K)$.

parameters.tightly connected: Dans un $k$-hypergraphe, suite d'arêtes $(e_i)$ avec $|e_i \cap e_{i+1}| = k-1$ reliant toute paire de sommets

label: Conjecture 4.3
text: For all $\alpha \geq 1$, there exists $\delta=\delta(\alpha)$ such that for all $r \geq 2$, if $G$ is a graph with $\alpha(G)=\alpha$, then $\mathrm{dc}_{r}^{\delta}(G) \leq(r-1) \alpha$.

parameters.\\mathrm{dc}_{r}^{\\delta}(G): Plus petit $t$ tel que toute $r$-coloration de $G$ admette une $t$-couverture monochromatique par des sous-graphes de diamètre $\le \delta$

label: Conjecture 4.17
text: Let $G$ be a 3-colored complete graph. There exists a monochromatic 2-cover consisting of subgraphs of diameter at most 3.

parameters.2-cover: Couverture monochromatique de taille au plus $2$

label: Conjecture 4.22
text: Suppose $G$ is a complete 4-partite graph with vertex set partitioned as $\left\{V_{1}, V_{2}, V_{3}, V_{4}\right\}$. If $\left[V_{i}, V_{j}\right]$ is colored with colors from $[5] \backslash\{i, j\}$ for all distinct $i, j \in[4]$, then $G$ can be covered with at most three monochromatic subgraphs of bounded diameter.

parameters.[V_i,V_j]: Sous-graphe biparti complet induit entre $V_i$ et $V_j$
parameters.trois sous-graphes: Au plus $3$ composantes connexes monochromatiques, de diamètre borné
